page.description: A list of properties and methods in the IndexInfo class.

property.name: Name
property.description: Default = "". The unique name of the table. Note: The table must be unique for the owner, but does not need to be globally unique.

property.name: Comment
property.description: Default = "". The comment stored for the table (if the database supports it).

property.name: Unique
property.description: Default = TRUE (.T.). True if this is a unique index.

property.name: PrimaryKey
property.description: Default = FALSE (.F.). True if the index is the primary key for this table.

property.name: Reference
property.description: Default = FALSE (.F.). True if this is a foreign key.

property.name: ReferenceTable
property.description: Default = "". For foreign keys only. The name of the table the index is assigned to.

property.name: ReferenceTableOwner
property.description: Default = "". For foreign keys only. The owner name of the referenced table.

property.name: IndexMethod
property.description: Default = "". The database specific indexing method.

property.name: Column
property.description: An array of the column definitions ( SQL::IndexColumnInfo ) for the index.

section.description: A SQL::IndexInfo object (an index description) is a container for one or more SQL::IndexColumnInfo objects (column descriptions for indexes). Each table in a SQL database has one or more relationships, constraints or indexes. The primary key, foreign keys, and unique and non-unique indexes are each described by a SQL::IndexInfo instance. The SQL::IndexInfo object contains a list of those indexes.
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim ti as SQL::TableInfo dim ii as SQL::IndexInfo dim ic as SQL::IndexColumnInfo dim connString as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v7\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" if .not. conn.open(connString) then end end if ic.name = "lastname" ii.AddColumn(ic) ii.unique = .f. ti.name = "customer" conn.CreateIndex(ti, ii) conn.close()
